title: DeGAUSS Metadata Specifications
text: list contains names supported metadata elements captured using environment variables defined using ENV instructions inside Dockerfile: degauss_name: name DeGAUSS container (use lower case letters underscores) degauss_version: version number corresponding GitHub release latest version container available GitHub Container Registry degauss_description: short (< 50 characters) description finishes sentence “container returns …” degauss_argument: name default value argument short argument description [default: x]

what: Defining Metadata Environment Variables in the Dockerfile
title: DeGAUSS Metadata Specifications
text: template Dockerfile {dht} (dht::use_degauss_dockerfile()) comes four (commented ENV instructions specifying optional command line argument) ENV must line define one variable time general, ENV instruction begins degauss_ can/read dht::get_degauss_env_dockerfile() dht::get_degauss_env_online()

title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: Within empty directory, use dht::use_degauss_container() create files needed DeGAUSS container. Note name initially empty directory used name geomarker documentation, code, image repository; good idea use lower case letters underscores (e.g., census_block_group) comply container naming conventions. added files usually need edited: However, files must edited:

previous_headings: Editing files to add R code and documentation
title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: Fill “Using”, “Geomarker Methods”, “Geomarker Data” sections README.md, applicable. Make sure version example call matches version latest released container. Within Dockerfile, ENV instructions used define environment variables capture metadata DeGAUSS container, including name (degauss_name), version (degauss_version), short description (degauss_description). environment variables available R code running inside container can used dht::greeting() well {dht} functions read write geomarker data. Outside DeGAUSS container, also used get_degauss_env_dockerfile(), get_degauss_env_online(), get_available_images(). creating new DeGAUSS container, degauss_description automatically defined value needs edited something specific short (ideally less 50 characters) finishes sentence “container returns …”, like releasing new version DeGAUSS container future, environment variable degauss_version can edited Dockerfile R code container can use greetings, writing output files, operations depend current version (name description). prevents need manually changing version number several different locations new release.
code: ENV degauss_description="insert short description here that finishes the sentence 'This container returns ...'" ENV degauss_description="proximity and length of major roads"

previous_headings: Editing files to add R code and documentation
what: Using R code and data files inside the container
title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: Edit entrypoint.R replacing example R code R code completes specific task performed container. ready build container, run renv::init() initiate renv framework create renv.lock. Subsequent builds can update renv.lock using renv::snapshot().

previous_headings: Editing files to add R code and documentation
title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: R packages, especially spatial packages, often depend external system dependencies. need installed using RUN instructions Dockerfile. example, {sf} package R requires gdal programs, require different install processes depending operating system. Since R packages always running inside Docker container running Ubuntu 20.04, can use remotes::system_requirements() get specific required install instructions {sf}: system requirements translated RUN instructions Dockerfile make sure available R packages require installed:
code: remotes::system_requirements("ubuntu-20.04", package = "sf") # "apt-get install -y libudunits2-dev" "apt-get install -y libssl-dev" # "apt-get install -y libgdal-dev"     "apt-get install -y gdal-bin" # "apt-get install -y libgeos-dev"     "apt-get install -y libproj-dev" RUN apt-get update \     && apt-get install -yqq --no-install-recommends \     libudunits2-dev \     libssl-dev \     libgdal-dev \     gdal-bin \     libgeos-dev \     libproj-dev \     && apt-get clean

title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: default, container copy entrypoint.R renv.lock use runtime ignore anything else working directory automatically speed build times keep containers smaller size. container requires files (e.g., .rds datafiles), edit Dockerfile .dockerignore files copied container ignored Docker. example, want use geomarker_data.rds, make following changes Dockerfile: .dockerignore:
code: COPY entrypoint.R .     COPY geomarker_data.rds    # copy .rds file from host to container when building # ignore everything     **      # except what we need     !/renv.lock     !/entrypoint.R     !/geomarker_data.rds      # make sure the .rds file is not ignored

title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: test directory added example geocoded address file (test/my_address_file_geocoded.csv) useful interactive development automated testing (see ).

title: Developing a New DeGAUSS Container
text: Makefile defines several useful make targets can useful locally developing testing: make build build current DeGAUSS image name make test run container included example geocoded CSV file make shell run DeGAUSS command, start interactive shell inside container debugging make clean equivalent docker system prune -f, cleans stopped containers dangling image layers

title: Helper Functions
text: (supplied values use greeting, inside DeGAUSS container automatically picked based environment variables capture metadata using just dht::greeting().)
code: greeting(   geomarker_name = "roads",   version = "0.1",   description = "calculates proximity and length of nearby major roadways" ) #>  #> ── Welcome to DeGAUSS! ── #>  #> • You are using roads, version 0.1 #> • This container returns calculates proximity and length of nearby major #> roadways #> • <https://degauss.org/roads> #>

title: Helper Functions
text: Returns list two elements – raw data tibble nested row (prevent calculations duplicate lat/lon).

what: Check that required columns are present
title: Helper Functions
text: Nothing returned column present. error thrown column present.
code: check_for_column(d, 'lat', d$lat) check_for_column(d, "nope", d$lat) #> ✖ no column called nope found in the input file #> Error:

title: Helper Functions
text: , nothing returned column type matches desired type. warning displayed column type match desired type.
code: check_for_column(d, 'lat', d$lat, 'numeric') check_for_column(d, 'lat', d$lat, 'character') #> ! lat is of type numeric, not character

what: Check that dates are read in correctly/reformat dates
title: Helper Functions
text: dates slash (1/1/21) ISO (2021-01-01) format, returned ISO format. dates another format, helpful error message generated.

title: Helper Functions
text: Unnests tibble created read_lat_lon_csv() merges back raw data, writes output csv container name version appended filename. inside DeGAUSS container, environment variables capture metadata available, can accomplished just:
code: write_geomarker_file(d = d,                       raw_data = d,                       filename = 'tests/my_address_file_geocoded.csv',                       geomarker_name = 'roads',                       version = '0.1') write_geomarker_file(d = d, raw_data = d, filename = opt$filename)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Erika Rasnick. Author, maintainer. Cole Brokamp. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rasnick E, Brokamp C (2022). dht: Collection Functions Assist Building DeGAUSS Containers. R package version 1.0.4, http://degauss.org/dht.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dht: A Collection of Functions to Assist Building DeGAUSS Containers},   author = {Erika Rasnick and Cole Brokamp},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.0.4},   url = {http://degauss.org/dht}, }

what: A Collection of Functions to Assist Building DeGAUSS Containers
title: A Collection of Functions to Assist Building DeGAUSS Containers
text: degauss helper tools used develop run DeGAUSS containers.

title: A Collection of Functions to Assist Building DeGAUSS Containers
text: Currently, package available GitHub. Install inside R :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("degauss-org/dht")

title: A Collection of Functions to Assist Building DeGAUSS Containers
text: Please see articles example usage best practices: Helper Functions Developing New DeGAUSS Container DeGAUSS Metadata Specifications

what: check if address is a known Cincinnati institutional address — address_is_institutional
title: check if address is a known Cincinnati institutional address — address_is_institutional
text: check address known Cincinnati institutional address

title: check if address is a known Cincinnati institutional address — address_is_institutional
code: address_is_institutional(address)

title: check if address is a known Cincinnati institutional address — address_is_institutional
text: address character vector address text

title: check if address is a known Cincinnati institutional address — address_is_institutional
text: logical vector; TRUE address contains text indicating Cincinnati Children's Hospital, Ronald McDonald House, Jobs Family Services Hamilton Butler Counties Ohio.

what: check if address text is not actually an address — address_is_nonaddress
title: check if address text is not actually an address — address_is_nonaddress
text: check address text actually address

title: check if address text is not actually an address — address_is_nonaddress
code: address_is_nonaddress(address)

title: check if address text is not actually an address — address_is_nonaddress
text: address character vector address text

title: check if address text is not actually an address — address_is_nonaddress
text: logical vector; TRUE address text "verify", "foreign", "foreign country", "unknown", blank.

what: check if address is a PO Box — address_is_po_box
title: check if address is a PO Box — address_is_po_box
text: check address PO Box

title: check if address is a PO Box — address_is_po_box
code: address_is_po_box(address)

title: check if address is a PO Box — address_is_po_box
text: address character vector address text

title: check if address is a PO Box — address_is_po_box
text: logical vector; TRUE address text contains variation "PO Box"

what: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates
title: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates
text: check format dates DeGAUSS container input file

title: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates
code: check_dates(date, allow_missing = FALSE)

title: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates
text: date vector dates checked formatting allow_missing logical. defaults FALSE, resulting error dates missing.

title: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates
text: reformatted vector dates, error dates reformatted

title: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates
text: ISO formatted dates (.e., "%Y-%m-%d" YYYY-MM-DD) stay U.S. standard slash formatted dates (common Microsoft Excel; e.g., "%m/%d/%y" MM/DD/YY, "%m/%d/%Y" MM/DD/YYYY) reformatted ISO format unrecognized input cause error user instructed reformat dates.

title: check format of dates from DeGAUSS container input file — check_dates

what: check that end_date occurs after start_date — check_end_after_start_date
title: check that end_date occurs after start_date — check_end_after_start_date
text: check end_date occurs start_date

title: check that end_date occurs after start_date — check_end_after_start_date
code: check_end_after_start_date(start_date, end_date)

title: check that end_date occurs after start_date — check_end_after_start_date
text: start_date vector start dates end_date vector end dates

title: check that end_date occurs after start_date — check_end_after_start_date
code: if (FALSE) { start_date <- check_dates(c("1/1/21", "1/2/21", "1/3/21")) end_date <- check_dates(c("1/7/21", "1/8/21", "1/9/20")) check_end_after_start_date(start_date, end_date) }

what: check for specified columns and corresponding column types — check_for_column
title: check for specified columns and corresponding column types — check_for_column
text: check specified columns corresponding column types

title: check for specified columns and corresponding column types — check_for_column
code: check_for_column(d, column_name, column, column_type = NULL)

title: check for specified columns and corresponding column types — check_for_column
text: d input dataframe column_name character string defining name column checked column character vector checked (e.g., d$column_name) column_type (optional) desired column type checked (e.g., 'character')

title: check for specified columns and corresponding column types — check_for_column
text: column_name exists d correct column_type, nothing returned. column_name exist d, error thrown. column correct column_type, warning shown.

title: check for specified columns and corresponding column types — check_for_column
code: if (FALSE) { d <- tibble::tribble(   ~"id", ~"value",   "123", 123,   "456", 456 ) check_for_column(d, "id", d$id, "double") check_for_column(d, "id2", d$id2, "double") }

code: check_ram(minimum_ram = 4)

title: check_ram — check_ram
text: minimum_ram minimum recommended GB RAM (numeric value)

text: vector character strings non-alphanumerics (except dashes, left +4 ZIP issues) excess white space removed.

title: Access the DeGAUSS color palette — degauss_colors
code: degauss_colors(n)

title: Access the DeGAUSS color palette — degauss_colors
text: n DeGAUSS color(s): 1-darkblue, 2-lightblue, 3-pink, 4-lightgrey, 5-purple, 6-teal)

title: Access the DeGAUSS color palette — degauss_colors
text: named character string vector named character strings containing RGB colors hexadecimal

title: Access the DeGAUSS color palette — degauss_colors
code: degauss_colors(2) #> [1] "#469FC2" degauss_colors(1:4) #> [1] "#072B67" "#469FC2" "#C2326B" "#E0E5E7" plot(1:6, rep(1, 6), col = degauss_colors(1:6), pch = 19, cex = 10)

what: expand dates between start_date and end_date — expand_dates
title: expand dates between start_date and end_date — expand_dates
text: expand dates start_date end_date

title: expand dates between start_date and end_date — expand_dates
code: expand_dates(d, by)

title: expand dates between start_date and end_date — expand_dates
text: d data.frame tibble columns called 'start_date' 'end_date' time interval expand dates (e.g., 'day', 'week', etc)

title: expand dates between start_date and end_date — expand_dates
text: long data.frame tibble column called 'date' including dates start_date end_date

title: expand dates between start_date and end_date — expand_dates
code: if (FALSE) { d <- data.frame(   start_date = check_dates(c("1/1/21", "1/2/21", "1/3/21")),   end_date = check_dates(c("1/7/21", "1/8/21", "1/9/21")) ) expand_dates(d, by = "day") }

what: get environment variables from a Dockerfile — get_degauss_env_dockerfile
title: get environment variables from a Dockerfile — get_degauss_env_dockerfile
text: functions look Dockerfile extract environment variables corresponding DeGAUSS container metadata. look ENV instructions name begins "degauss_"; example "degauss_name", "degauss_version". get_degauss_env_dockerfile expects path Dockerfile, get_degauss_env_online takes name DeGAUSS container used download corresponding Dockerfile (master branch github repository). assumes ENV instruction line defines one environment variable.

title: get environment variables from a Dockerfile — get_degauss_env_dockerfile
code: get_degauss_env_dockerfile(   dockerfile_path = fs::path_join(c(getwd(), "Dockerfile")) )  get_degauss_env_online(name = "fortunes")  get_available_images()

title: get environment variables from a Dockerfile — get_degauss_env_dockerfile
text: dockerfile_path path Dockerfile name name DeGAUSS container download Dockerfile

title: get environment variables from a Dockerfile — get_degauss_env_dockerfile
text: named vector DeGAUSS metatdata elements

title: get environment variables from a Dockerfile — get_degauss_env_dockerfile
code: if (FALSE) { use_degauss_dockerfile(version = "0.1") get_degauss_env_dockerfile() get_degauss_env_dockerfile()["degauss_version"] get_degauss_env_online("fortunes") get_degauss_env_online("fortunes")["degauss_version"] }

what: display DeGAUSS greeting message in console — greeting
title: display DeGAUSS greeting message in console — greeting
text: supplied arguments, greeting-specific values (geomarker_name, version, description) read environment variables specified Dockerfile made available running container; include degauss_name, degauss_version, degauss_description

title: display DeGAUSS greeting message in console — greeting
code: greeting(   geomarker_name = Sys.getenv("degauss_name"),   version = Sys.getenv("degauss_version"),   description = Sys.getenv("degauss_description") )

title: display DeGAUSS greeting message in console — greeting
text: geomarker_name name geomarker, must name used degauss.org url version container version number character string description brief description container; finishes sentence "container returns..."

title: display DeGAUSS greeting message in console — greeting
text: greeting message includes name, version, brief description container, well link information specific geomarker

title: display DeGAUSS greeting message in console — greeting
code: if (FALSE) { greeting("roads", "0.4", "returns proximity and length of nearby major roadways") }

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

what: wrapper for base::library() that automatically supresses package startup messages — qlibrary
title: wrapper for base::library() that automatically supresses package startup messages — qlibrary
text: note renv pickup dependencies loaded using function recommended use something like withr::with_message_sink("/dev/null", library(dplyr))  instead

title: wrapper for base::library() that automatically supresses package startup messages — qlibrary
code: qlibrary(...)

title: wrapper for base::library() that automatically supresses package startup messages — qlibrary
text: ... arguments passed base::library()

title: wrapper for base::library() that automatically supresses package startup messages — qlibrary
code: if (FALSE) { qlibrary(dplyr) }

what: read in and format input file for DeGAUSS container — read_lat_lon_csv
title: read in and format input file for DeGAUSS container — read_lat_lon_csv
text: read format input file DeGAUSS container

title: read in and format input file for DeGAUSS container — read_lat_lon_csv
code: read_lat_lon_csv(   filename,   nest_df = FALSE,   sf_out = FALSE,   project_to_crs = NULL )

title: read in and format input file for DeGAUSS container — read_lat_lon_csv
text: filename name input file, probably opt$filename inside container nest_df logical. TRUE, data nested lat/lon. Defaults FALSE. sf_out logical. TRUE, data converted sf object. Defaults FALSE. project_to_crs (optional) sf_out=TRUE, crs input data projected. unspecified sf_out=TRUE, crs defaults 4326.

title: read in and format input file for DeGAUSS container — read_lat_lon_csv
text: list two elements. first raw_data read input file. second tibble nested lat lon prevent duplication geomarker computations. sf_out=TRUE second sf object.

title: read in and format input file for DeGAUSS container — read_lat_lon_csv
code: if (FALSE) { d <- read_lat_lon_csv(filename = "test/my_address_file_geocoded.csv") d <- read_lat_lon_csv(   filename = "test/my_address_file_geocoded.csv",   sf_out = TRUE, project_to_crs = 5072 ) }

title: use DeGAUSS compose file — use_degauss_compose
text: creates docker-compose yaml file current working directory

title: use DeGAUSS compose file — use_degauss_compose
code: use_degauss_compose(...)

title: use DeGAUSS compose file — use_degauss_compose
text: ... arguments passed render_degauss_template (overwrite)

title: use DeGAUSS container template — use_degauss_container
text: Creates necessary files create DeGAUSS container. container/geomarker name assumed basename working directory version R renv taken calling environment. function calls individual dht::use_degauss_*() functions create following: Dockerfile Makefile README.md entrypoint.R .dockerignore test/my_address_file_geocoded.csv LICENSE GPL license .github/workflows/build-deploy-pr.yaml .github/workflows/build-deploy-release.yaml

title: use DeGAUSS container template — use_degauss_container
code: use_degauss_container(geomarker = getwd(), version = "0.1.0", ...)  use_degauss_dockerfile(geomarker = getwd(), version, ...)  use_degauss_makefile(geomarker = getwd(), ...)  use_degauss_readme(geomarker = getwd(), version = "0.1.0", ...)  use_degauss_githook_readme_rmd(geomarker = getwd(), ...)  use_degauss_entrypoint(geomarker = getwd(), version = "0.1.0", ...)  use_degauss_dockerignore(geomarker = getwd(), ...)  use_degauss_tests(geomarker = getwd(), ...)  use_degauss_license(geomarker = getwd(), ...)  use_degauss_github_actions(geomarker = getwd(), ...)

title: use DeGAUSS container template — use_degauss_container
text: geomarker path folder DeGAUSS container files added; defaults current working directory version string version number used freshly created README entrypoint.R; defaults "0.1.0" ... arguments passed render_degauss_template (overwrite)

what: write geomarker output to file — write_geomarker_file
title: write geomarker output to file — write_geomarker_file
text: write geomarker output file

title: write geomarker output to file — write_geomarker_file
code: write_geomarker_file(   d,   raw_data = NULL,   filename,   geomarker_name = Sys.getenv("degauss_name"),   version = Sys.getenv("degauss_version"),   argument = NULL )

title: write geomarker output to file — write_geomarker_file
text: d input nest .row added geomarker column(s) raw_data original unnested input data, defaults NULL (use nest_df = FALSE read_lat_lon_csv) filename name input file, probably opt$filename inside container geomarker_name name geomarker; defaults degauss environment variable degauss_name version container version number character string; defaults degauss environment variable degauss_version argument optional information append image version number specified using degauss argument; example, selected buffer radius, care site, geocoding threshold

title: write geomarker output to file — write_geomarker_file
text: output file written working directory

title: write geomarker output to file — write_geomarker_file
code: if (FALSE) { write_geomarker_file(d$d, d$raw_data,   filename = "test/my_address_file_geocoded.csv",   geomarker = "roads", version = "0.4" ) }
